page.title: 12A BREWERY IN BURTON
page.content: Page 2 (of 2) Marstons is very much a regional brewery for the area round Burton, but has other sites scattered from Penrith to Winchester. They own 884 public houses, mostly in the Midlands, but their beer is sold as far away as the 'Bon Accord' in Glasgow. Burton owes its breweries to the local water, which rises through a gypsum layer, and gives the beer its sparkle. They became famous in the days of empire, when Burton beer was sent all over the world for the troops. Now smaller breweries are steadily being amalgamated, although the volume brewed has risen greatly since the war. Younger people now prefer lager instead of the traditional English bitter, and public houses are becoming more a part of the family leisure industry instead of just drinking places.
